reviewText: Never has received her due as a dramatic actress but a voice and technique that could have only been made in heaven!
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: Lest we forget just how great she is.  It showed a side of her I never heard about before. one
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: Her last special as I understand it. She sings some classics, but the material seems exceptionally canned and forced and really stuck in the era in which it was done. I think this special is really just for Doris devotees and pretty much not for anyone else.
summary: Love Doris, but not so much in this
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: Not as good as I had hoped but the John Denver songs as well as Doris and the duets were a-ok. Not a fan of the so called comics and would have liked more music.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: GREAT SEEING ALL THE STARS FROM THE PAST AND ENJOYING DORIS DAYS GREAT VOICE
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: I bought this mostly because John Denver was in it.  I would have liked the clips with him with Doris Day separate on a John Denver DVD but that's just me.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: I remember seing this TV special 32 years ago. I was 1 year old when I saw it. NOT!Doris Day went into retirement shortly after this TV special aired. Long tired of TV and movies, Miss Day just left the biz while she was still on top. I hope she is doing well. Glad this finally got a video release to enjoy it all over again.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: This is one of the two specials Doris did for CBS, and it is impossible to resist her charm.Her rendition of "The Way We Were" is on par with the jazzy version of "Hooray For Hollywood" that is sampled all the time.  Listen to BOTH songs in full, to get their impact.(of course "Hooray" is not on this item, but find it!)Doris was always a style maven, and she looks fantastic.  You will LOVE this!  Doris was in fine form, and you can tell that production spent time and money to assure a great show.The 70's and 80's were hard for many stars, Doris included.This is a great snapshot of the time- a sensational show with a superstar talent.  At the time it remined one of the highest rated television shows of the year.How foolish of CBS and the studios to ignore her charm, talent and ability to attract an audience.  I am quite sure that she never thought this would  be a good bye to her millions of fans.  I hope you enjoy the show as much as I did.P.S. For those of you who are HUGE Doris fan's (like me!) -- Can you imagine how nice the CBS series "Murder She Wrote" might have been with with our Super-Style Doris?Nothing against dear Angela, but Doris would have rocked the airwaves in that part!Do get this DVD at the great AMAZON price, and share it-- we simply do NOT have talent and style like this anymore.  Enjoy!
summary: You will want this!  TRUST ME!!
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: If you didn't live in the 1970's you might watch this TV special and think that that was what television looked like in the 1970's, and you would be largely correct. Then, as now, there was mostly crap on TV with occasional bright spots. Most of the bright spots, as the flood of DVDs from that era suggest, are best remembered as opposed to revisited. This special is painful to watch. The stilted dialog and bad jokes, which are always followed by a cacophony of canned laughter, are just so bad. Doris' singing is also painful as she tries to be hip and now by singing "Day By Day," a tuneless faux rock song from the musical Godspell. John Denver had just moved from being a sincere folk singer in the mold of Tom Paxton, to being a Superstar pal of Frank Sinatra, a career path which eventually would cost Denver his credibility and send his recording career spiraling down. On this special he trades unfunny quips with Doris, but then, just when it seemed impossible for anything good to happen, he sings his oldie "Follow Me," as Doris Day sits cross-legged on the floor and lays on a marvelous harmony. This could have been a really great show, if they had just done away with the lame comedy and sung songs that were suited to them. Tim Conway does some pointless and uncharacteristically unfunny comedy with Doris. There are some other guests also. So, this is completely a waste of time. It was a waste in 1975 and it is a waste now, except, somehow, it is fun to watch. It is a little time machine into the era of President Ford; an America adjusting, uncomfortably, to a powerful youth culture and the presence of African Americans in the mainstream. CBS was still a colossus, operating as it had for decades. And Doris Day, one of the great movie stars a decade earlier, trying to stay relevant.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: I have been a fan of Doris Day for a long time and enjoy watching her and listening to her sing. There aren't many stars today that will ever be like her - stars of her legend was slowly fading away and this video will keep that image for a very long time.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: This is DVD of a very pleasant television show.Various elements are included, and costarring with John Denver is above all interesting.And Doris sings "The Way We Were" in this show, and this is splendid at all. She sings so that various memories of her own appear.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: In 1975 Doris Day completed her obligation to CBS Television by starring in a hugely popular one hour variety show.  This beautifully produced special is rated five stars because Doris Day sings.  That in itself warrants five stars.Looking no more than 25 years old, Miss Day is in top-form and one can only regret that she didn't do more specials, or films, or recordings after this outing.  Vocally she is superb!!!The special generously mixes comic skits with musical interludes and utilizes Miss Day's guest stars, John Denver, Rich Little, Tim Conway and the dancing group, The Lockers, to good effect. While the comedy sketches are not especially side-splitting, Miss Day and Conway are amusing together.John Denver is probably the most prominent guest on the show and he proves to be disarming.  His chemistry with Miss Day is genuine and real and they run the gamut from "Follow Me", a Sunshine medley, "Exactly Like You" and a very cute series of song snippets that use the stars' real names and vintage tunes. Day and Denver look more like brother and sister.The sequence with Rich Little imitating, flawlessly, several of Miss Day's on-screen co-stars is a great excuse for Day to sing bits of some of her most beloved hits including "Everybody Loves a Lover", "Teacher's Pet", "Secret Love" and the inevitable, "Whatever Will be, Will Be".Finally it is Doris Day who makes the hour work. Her vocal rendering of "Day by Day" from the musical "Godspell" is pitch perfect.  "The Way We Were" has NEVER been sung more beautifully than Miss Day's version.Among the bonus features on this DVD release is Miss Day's appearance on the December, 1974 John Denver Special.  She, Denver and George Gobel do a very funny skit that pokes good natured fun at Miss Day's on-screen image.  Day and Denver sing bits of three songs from Day's early 50's musicals.As a wonderful reminder of what a brilliant vocalist Doris Day is, this DVD release should be a must for everyone.
summary: DORIS DAY TODAY AND EVERY DAY!
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: This is a collectors must! However, the title is totally wrong ... as this was Doris Day in the mid-70s ...  a great entertainer, one of the very best ... and most of us know what becomes of the best of the best ... they become extremely reclusive ... survivalists! More power to you, DoDo!
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: This 1975 "Special" is a time capsule. In the 70s network TV was doing lots of Variety Shows (have you seen a "variety" show on TV in the last 20 years?) and you could see all kinds of music in one hour.This show - the main reason for this DVD - was produced by George Schlatter, who was responsible for "Laugh-In" during the same time period. You can tell from the sets and the corny jokes and the comic sketches with Tim Conwa But Day looks super and the print is great! Rich Little does a nice bit with Day where she sings songs from all her movies and Little recreates the leading men. And there a huge amount of screen time given to John Denver.. enough that this could have been a Day/Denver special.The bonus features are nice addition:A 1940s "Soundies" of Day with Les Brown's band (taken from the wonderful "Music Classics" series that MPI has put out and which I watch often.An ILLUSTRATED Discography of Day Lps and CDSA full episode from her situation comedy series "The Doris Day Show" titled "Doris Goes To Hollywood" where the fictional Doris goes to see the "Real" Doris. (MPI has the full series on a separate DVD set.A 10-minute segment with Doris appearing on Denver's 1974 TV variety show.So, Day fans will want this and so will Denver Fans! (And, if there are George Gobel fans out there (are there?) he's on the special too!)
summary: Definitely for Day and John Denver Fans-LOTS of bonus material
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: This was purchased by me and given as a gift.  As is customary, fast shipping by Amazon.  Item was packaged well.  No damage, no issues.  My friend has watched this and they loved it.
Title: Doris Day Today

reviewText: Doris  Day alone is a wonderful, uplifting experience. Her chemistry with John Denver is as good as(if  not better) than the chemistry she had with Rock Hudson.
Title: Doris Day Today
